title.narrative: CROSS-SECTORIAL

description.narrative: Cross Sectoral, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Communications/External relations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Cross Sectoral

description.narrative: In 2021 UNICEF participated in different media interviews and online seminars advocating to assure the continuity of learning for all children during the COVID-19 pandemic. In August, UNICEF submitted its confidential report for Chile to CRC with UN Country Team contribution and took part in the pre-session discussion, promoting the participation of adolescent groups. The upcoming dialogue with the state will also benefit from UNICEF’s suggested recommendations. UNICEF supported the Undersecretary of Children by implementing direct interventions with migrant families and children on the northern border. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
